meanings.definition: Surjections: Functions that map elements of one set onto elements of another set.
meanings.sent1: In mathematics, surjections are like arrows connecting two groups of things.
meanings.sent2: The surjections ensure that every item in the second set has a corresponding item in the first set.
meanings.sent3: The surjections were like magical bridges between the two lands of numbers.
meanings.sent4: Her surjections painted a vivid picture of how each element found its match in the other set.
meanings.sent5: The concept of surjections stuck in my mind like a colorful puzzle piece.

meanings.definition: Surjections: Functions that are onto, meaning every element in the codomain is mapped to by at least one element in the domain.
meanings.sent1: The surjections in this case ensure that no element is left behind in the mapping process.
meanings.sent2: With surjections, every destination in the second set has a traveler from the first set.
meanings.sent3: The surjections threw a party where every guest had a dance partner.
meanings.sent4: Her surjections were like a spotlight, making sure every element had its moment on stage.
meanings.sent5: The idea of surjections bloomed in my mind like a garden of interconnected paths.
